column2: text
Araby Prejudice
Araby holds ancient bonds and hatreds though they have mellowed with time.
Diplomatic relations: %+n with the factions of [[img:ovn_scythans]][[/img]]Aswad Scythans, [[img:ovn_araby]][[/img]]Caliphate of Araby & [[img:ovn_scimitar]][[/img]]the Flaming Scimitar.
Immune to Desert Attrition
Enables recruitment of certain Tomb King units
A roving camp which grows with the mercenaries reputation.
Wide selection of rare and powerful legendary mercenaries
Of Magic and Coin
Long thought dead, Jaffar has arisen through some nefarious way and taken back power ushering in a new age of magic and trade.
Of Dune and Crypt
The Scythans were once a nomadic people but now serve and defend the deserts of the Tomb Kings to the east.
Of Sea and Sand
Led by the seafaring Golden Magus these veteran sailors have been far and wide in search of gold and glory.
Servants of Order: Cannot declare war on Empires States, Bretonnian Kingdoms and Dawi Realms
Barbarian Hatred: No peace just war with Norscan factions
Can only enter into diplomacy with Chaos worshipping, Greenskin or Rogue factions
Of Pies and Tobaccy
Halflings are famous for three things: Pies, Tobacco and Thieving, all of which can make a pretty penny.
Diplomatic relations: %+n with Dwarfs, Men & Elves
Diplomatic relations: -25 with Averland
Forces are resistant to Chaos corruption
Grudgebringer Mercenaries
Veterans of many campaigns the Grudgebringer mercenaries are hailed as heroes from the courts of Altdorf, Zhufbar, Loren and beyond.
Dark Omen
The Dread King has arisen through dark magics and will usher in a new age of dread and darkness.

Well-Fed
We iz full for now!
Access to the Skittergate which allows your lord to teleport across the world, when the Skaven have found enough Warpfuel that is
From The Mist They Come
We come for your women folk, resistance is futile!
Too Stupid To Care
We eat, we smash, we eat what we smash, what else is there?
Curse of the Dark Gods
You waste time searching for mere trinkets? True power lies with us fool!
Curse of the Dark Gods
You do nothing, NOTHING! You don't have enough coin? Here, let me thin your ranks for you!
Favour of the Dark Gods
This pleases us, take this gift and bring ruin to the world!
Gains bonuses when Eatine and the Eastern Shores of Lustria are held by High Elves.
Receives penalties when Eatine and the Eastern Shores of Lustria are not held by High Elves.
Can recruit Nobles without the required building
All High Elf Legendary Lords leave temporary bonuses on regions they visit belonging to the Citadel of Dusk.
Improved diplomatic relations with Lothern and Order of Loremasters, for a little while at least.
Of Booty and Cargo

The Citadel of Dusk is a site of tremendous strategic importance as it allows the Asuryan navy to patrol, protect and ultimately control the western sea trade routes to Cathay and Nippon whilst suppressing the threat of Druchii corsairs & undead pirates to Ulthuan.
Cannibals
Out of hunger, these trolls have taken to eating their kin.

Swirling Mist

Fimir strongholds are seldom seen by outsiders, for they are wreathed in thick mist, a miasma which is magically generated by the Fimir to shield their fortresses from prying eyes, and themselves from the harsh glare of the sun.
This army has gained the favour of the Dark Ones, wreak havoc and they will knit your gaping bloody wounds.
